thread.title: Alabama fans marry at Tennessee tailgate. And one of the guests wears a Speedo
thread.title_full: Alabama fans marry at Tennessee tailgate. And one of the guests wears a Speedo

author: Leada Gore | lgore@al.com
title: Alabama fans marry at Tennessee tailgate. And one of the guests wears a Speedo
text:
Alabama fans marry at Tennessee tailgate. And one of the guests wears a Speedo Alabama wedding.JPG Knoxville television station WATE's Michael Spencer captured images from a wedding held during a pre-game tailgate ahead of the Alabama/Tennesee game. (Contributed photo/Michael Spencer) Comments 
It's common knowledge – or at least it should be – that you don't schedule a wedding on a Saturday during football season. 
So what do you do if you want to tie the knot and still root on your favorite team? Here's a solution: Just plan your wedding for the pre-game tailgate. 
Two Alabama fans, known as "Chip and Carrie" said their vows ahead of today's Alabama/Tennessee game. The wedding was captured in photos and tweets by Knoxville television station WATE's Michael Spencer. There is a wedding going on in the tailgate area at Bama right now. Got to hang with the officiant. pic.twitter.com/H22GASfDLU — Michael Spencer (@WATEMichael) October 24, 2015 The crowd has gathered for the wedding. pic.twitter.com/PSGPB3rzkZ — Michael Spencer (@WATEMichael) October 24, 2015 This is a legit wedding. pic.twitter.com/1yCP1jJkmH — Michael Spencer (@WATEMichael) October 24, 2015 Congrats to Chip and Carrie. pic.twitter.com/vD44sL4Kwe — Michael Spencer (@WATEMichael) October 24, 2015 
The photos quickly spread online and sharp-eyed viewers honed in on one particular guest (no, not the Bama Pope, whatever is going on with that.) The photos show a man wearing an Alabama shirt and, for some reason, a Speedo-style bathing suit. 
You can see that a little clearer here: — We're From Tennessee (@LoneNutVolFan) October 24, 2015 
There's no explanation as to why the man is wearing a bathing suit at the wedding or who exactly "Chip and Carrie" are but we wish them the best. And a big Roll Tide.
